ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I think we covered important material. Might not be relevant for non-physics grad students though.
Yes. This was an excellent class and I learned a great deal.
This is a must-take class for any physicist.
As a requirement for Physics and Applied Physics grad students, this course is in my option very interested and rather fun! Do take it with Prof Alhassid.
Yes, a very important basic course in physics.
This was a really good class, with lots of physical reasoning combined with mathematical precision.
Covers the basics of statistical physics.
Yes I would because I actually learned a lot about statistical physics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I think I definitely understand a few central parts of stat mech on a much deeper level now.
It is unclear to what extent I will use the topics covered.
Stat mech is useful almost no matter what field you study. Learning any amount of it is certain to be beneficial at some point.
I has already come up in my research so I am sure it will be very useful.
